page.title: 08ST.ANDREW'S CHURCH KEMBERTON
page.content: The church is dedicated to both St.Andrew and St.John the Baptist. Built on the site of several former churches it was started in 1889. The tower was added between 1906 and 1908. In the nave there are reproductions of 15th century tiles which were found when the present church was being built.They were made by Craven Dunhill of Jackfield and show hunting scenes. There is a marble pulpit and a carved wooden communion table which dates from the 18th century. The communion vessels are 16th century. The church has 4 bells dated 1596, 1621, 1671, 1753.About 2 years ago a small band was formed to start ringing them again after an interval of 26 years. Two hand-written illuminated 'Books Of Memory' contain the names of local men who served in the First World War.
